page.title: 08LOCAL SHOPS
page.content: There are few shops. The busiest were the VG food store, the general store, the Post Office, the Bakers' and Butchers'. These mainly{serve {local people}who buy on a daily basis or who pop in for food or items that they forgot to get from the larger shops in bigger towns. Day's is a{traditional bakers.}People from Baldock and Letchworth go there for bread and the bakery supplies other shops in Letchworth and Stevenage. Neville Crump and his father have run a butchers in Mill Lane since the 1870s. He draws customers from as far afield as Stevenage and Cambridge. People like his{old-fashioned skill}and his home-made pates are popular. There are no shops in Newnham but one man rents out{costumes}for theatricals or fancy-dress parties from his house.
